definition: to knock off work for the day
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: He likes a drink when he returns home from work.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢放工回家后喝一杯酒。

sentences.english: I should come again from work by 6. Do you know where King Streetis?
sentences.chinese: 我6点钟之前会放工回来。你领略国王街在哪吗？

sentences.english: Wed just be letting slightly over half the folks out a little early.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是让一半多一点儿的人早一点儿放工。

sentences.english: On Saturday night, on her way home from work, she was robbed.
sentences.chinese: 星期六早晨，在放工回家的路上，她被抢了。

sentences.english: I just come home from work.
They often wine and dine at the local bar after work.
sentences.chinese: 他们放工之后，经常去当地的酒吧吃吃喝喝。

sentences.english: I just came home got off work.
John perma certainently goes straight home even after work.
sentences.chinese: 约翰放工后总是间接回家。

sentences.english: After working , colourful clothes replace the blue uniforms.
sentences.chinese: 放工之后，蓝制服都换成了颜色娇艳的衣服。

sentences.english: I like go home AS soon AS possible after work.
sentences.chinese: 放工后我喜欢尽快回家。

sentences.english: There must be no further delays. The drop-dead date/deadline is next Friday's close of business.
sentences.chinese: 不能再推迟了，最后期限是下周五放工的时候。

sentences.english: Tuesday is Winter Solstice and the KCRC estimates many people will leave work early.
sentences.chinese: 星期二是冬至，九铁预期很多人会提早放工。

sentences.english: I just want to relax and watch TV after work.
sentences.chinese: 放工后我只想看电视，抓紧抓紧。

sentences.english: In London it's five o'clock and people are leaving work and are going home.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦，当初是五点钟，人们正在放工回家。

definition: to sleep (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 睡覺|睡觉[shui4 jiao4]
to release from work at the end of the day
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
